name: Rosemary and Apricot French Loaf
author: Jessica Lissner
summary: This is a sweet bread that seems quite fancy and is actually not much more work than a simple French loaf. I went to an Irish bakery once and they had apricot bread. In my imagination, this is the recipe I was thinking of so I made this up when the Irish bakery didn't read my mind.
directions: Place water, olive oil, and salt into one side of a bread machine
Place 1/3 of the apricots on top of this fluid mixture with 2 cups of flour
Place more apricots in the middle of the flour, pour remaining flour on top, followed by remaining apricots
This will help weaker bread machines integrate the apricots
Run French loaf cycle for a 2-pound loaf
Remove from the machine after the cycle is done, about 3 1/2 hours
